Looks a natural move but it hands the advantage to black. Better was Be4 threatening the R
moves.14... Bb7 15. Bf4: This was a simple misreading of my own analysis notes. Should have been Be4. Moral - Dont play when tired.
moves.15... Bb4 16. Nd2: Trying to protect the R and keep it in the semi open file. Much better was the simple Rf1.
moves.17... h4 18. Rec1 e5 19. Nb3 Kd8 20. Bd2: Playing my best options but these trades are working in black's favour
moves.22. f3 Nc5 23. Bf5 Bc8:
Finally black is human after all. I assume looking to continue trades. Better was Ke7 connecting the Rs and protecting the doubled pawns.
Alternative variation: 23... Ke7 24. Kh1 Ne6
looking at all the attacks i was making and get rid of the h3 pawn. But better was Nb3 giving the Q room to work and protect b4.
Trying to clear a space for some Q-side action
moves.37... fxg3 38. hxg3: Now blacks line up is looking dangerous. Note for lower ranked players who attack with just one piece. Look at the combination of R Q B and pawn
moves.38... h2+ 39. Kh1 Qh3 40. Nd2 e4 41. Qb8: A mistake. Far better was e3 attacking the N and threatening another Q chance.
moves.42. Nxf3 Qf5 43. Rf1: finally that R wakes up and gets into the game.
moves.43... d3 44. Qc7+ Bd7 45. Qc4 Be6 46. Qc: And here having survived enormous pressure for the last 20 moves i missed my one chance of salvation. The correct move was 63.Qd4+ forcing a Q trade and from that the game is drawn.
moves.63. Qh7+: Alternative variation: 63. Qd4+ Qxd4+ 64. Kxd4 Ke7 65. Ke5
moves.63... Kc8: Black still has to play carefully to bring home the win. I give him a few more moves to see if he will trip up.
moves.64. Qa7 Qe4+ 65. Kc3 Qc4+ 66. Kd2 Qxb4+: The game is over so I resign. Well played Monkofunk. Pressure all the way so a well deserved win. And promotion to the 2200+ club.
